meanings.sent1: The kids were barraging the teacher with questions after class.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were barraging the government with demands for change.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels barraging the bird feeder with acorns was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The storm was barraging the coast with heavy rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The chef was barraging the dish with spices to enhance the flavor.

meanings.definition: A rapid and continuous delivery of something
meanings.sent1: The barraging of emails in my inbox was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The barraging of compliments made her blush.
meanings.sent3: The barraging of jokes during the comedy show kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The barraging of advertisements on the website was annoying.
meanings.sent5: The barraging of snow during the blizzard covered the entire town.
